Otherwise it was an absolutely wonderful space for a single night stay.

The host was responsive with directions and info on checkout. There are plenty of places within walking distance or a short drive, including the Fork & Spoon community restaurant which is a couple blocks away. I would definitely like to stay here again when Iâ€™m in the area.

We really enjoyed meeting the host, Katie who is knowledgeable about Bozeman, skiing, and the airbnb business in general. We plan to stay at this studio on future trips to Bozeman to visit our son.

The two other bedrooms had higher beds which our 3 girls enjoyed. The high beds made great private spaces for the kids. They would be more difficult for any adults. The amenities in the house were great. It was a good place to stay for a trip to Montana to visit relatives.
I would recommend this place to anyone.

Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
May 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This place is such a gem, and so were the hosts! They put such attention to detail to the studio that made us feel so at home.
Not only was the place beautiful and tidy, they went above and beyond with making sure that we're well taken care of. They had little signs in the studio with things like recommendations for places to eat near the area, etc. They had Roku with guest mode so you don't have to worry about forgetting to sign out of your streaking accounts when you check out. They also provided snacks and drinks, which is not something I normally see provided in other Airbnbs. They just made things really convenient for us so we can maximize our enjoyment of the vacation.
Another plus here is that they didn't have so many check-out instructions like other Airbnbs do. I've stayed at other places where they had specific instructions on removing the sheets and towels and putting them in one place, etc. I was pleasantly surprised that they made both check-in and check-out really seamless for this place.
If we're ever back in Bozeman, I will definitely choose to stay here again!

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
June 2023
,
Â·
Stayed over a week
review_text: Cody and Molly were such great hosts. Friendly, responsive, communicative, and run a great AirBnB. I spent 3 weeks here. Loved the big open windows with views out into the mountains. There was a dedicated table for working, but could also work at the kitchen counter or the couch. Internet was fast and reliable for conference calls. The space was sparkling clean. Looked brand new and like no one had ever stayed in it before. All of the furniture and bed were comfortable, easy climate control, and full kitchen, equipped with everything you need for a short or extended stay. Even have Greenpan non-stick ceramic pans which are the best. Easy parking with your own spot and keyless entry. The unit is above the garage and separate from the main house, so it's very quiet. The neighborhood itself is also very quiet, safe, and serene. Great place to walk your dog, yourself, and even a couple little trails nearby. Bozeman downtown about 10 mins, and about 30mins to some great hiking.

name: Kjirsten
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
August 2021
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text: Just wow. What an amazing place to stay! The cabin is packed with adorable details that make it so welcoming and cozy. You can see how much thought and effort has been put into making this a great place to stay. The bed is so comfortable - I slept like a rock and the bedding was soft and warm. There were options for both warming and cooling the cabin, so it can be set to whatever temperature is comfortable for you. Don't let the lack of running water deter you - a big carafe of drinking water was chilled and waiting in the fridge for me. The bathroom was super clean and smelled fresh, and they created a makeshift sink (that worked perfectly) so you can wash hands with soap and water. You can't beat the location, as it is only a couple minutes from groceries, restaurants, and shops in the downtown area, yet is perched just outside the hustle and bustle on a beautiful, serene property. I was even greeted by neighing horses as I arrived. 10/10 would stay again!

review_text:
The CowboyUp Cabin was wonderful! We found it to be super clean, quiet, comfortable, and convenient. We found we had everything we needed. We stayed for four days while in town visiting family. Three beautiful and friendly horses kept us company right outside the cabin and it was awesome looking out the kitchen window to grazing horses. My children especially loved petting and visiting them.
Unfortunately, our stay was during a serious heat wave with temps in the mid 90s (really hot for Bozeman) and the cabin doesnâ€™t have central A/C (neither do most places in the area). It does have a very nice window A/C unit in the main bedroom, ceiling fans, and an extra portable fan in the 2nd bedroom. We were able to leave the windows open at night, run the fans, window A/C, and stay comfortable.
Highly recommend the CowboyUp Cabin for your next stay in Bozeman, especially if you want that country feel.

We had asked for a refund for that first day of our stay that we missed, only because it was a very extreme event, and that didnâ€™t work out. We didnâ€™t realize how important that option is with extreme weather that alters a trip and we learned very quickly what an important option that is to have with all of the other airbnbers around us getting help from their hosts. name: Christine
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
May 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The only disappointing thing about Chris and Emilee's space is that we couldn't enjoy it longer! The studio is light, airy, and spacious, with windows on each side and minimalist decor. The space is very clean. The kitchen area is well-equipped with an electric stove, small fridge/freezer, microwave, Keurig coffeemaker, and all the pots, pans, dishes, and utensils needed. After seeing the kitchen, we decided not to go out to eat. There is a chain grocery store about five minutes away with all the necessities, including fresh, ready-to-heat meals. The bed is comfortable and the bedding feels luxurious. There is a desk with good lighting, and Wi-Fi works well. The bathroom towels are also nice and soft. Communication with the hosts was excellent! They responded within a few minutes and answered my questions fully.
While I would highly recommend Chris and Emilee's studio, there are a few things to consider. I think this space is for the travelers who are looking for a place to unwind after a busy day or to get work done without distractions. The studio is located in a quiet neighborhood, not within walking distance to shops/restaurants/activities. We found the nights to be dark, peaceful, and relaxing. There is no television in the studio, but the hosts have thoughtfully provided books pertaining to Montana, Yellowstone, and outdoor themes in general. Also, the space is above a garage, so it may not be the right space for anyone who can not negotiate stairs.
It was the perfect space for us! Thank you so much, Chris and Emilee!

They not only offer us to cancel the trip for free but also would give us 175 dollars of refund if we decided to stay. Eventually we decided to stay with them and luckily the water was back on the second evening. Their place is clean warm and quiet. We even saw deers passing by in the evening :-) The kitchen is fully equipped so we could prepare breakfast and lunch by ourselves. We would love to come back if we visit big sky again.

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Well, this was probably the BEST airbnb I've ever stayed in. Immaculately clean, all the amenities one could need, even great, local coffee was included! Though let me explain who this airbnb is ideal for:
1) If you are a writer looking to finish your book/screenplay, this provides a wonderfully private, comfortable space away from the world to do so. Amazing desk and chair and, best of all, NO distracting TV - yay!
2) If you're someone who just wants to experience Montana, you're a 10 minute drive from Bozeman, a 30 minute drive from Livingston, a hour north of Big Sky, etc. It's got this perfect combination of feeling like you're out in the middle of nowhere (it sure gets quiet at night), but not entirely (the closest supermarket is 2 miles away).
I predict this will be one of those places that's always booked, considering it's location, price, and how lovely it is. If you want to see Montana, I can't imagine finding a better spot!
